oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt 2 from oral history interview with Roger DuVal Baskette, Sr., 2003 January 27
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Roger DuVal Baskette, Sr., conducted on 27 January 2003 by Robert P. Richardson as part of the Nashville Public Library's Veterans History Project. Baskette, a gunner in the 90th Chemical Mortar Battalion, III Corps, U.S. Army from 1942-1946, discusses arriving in Southampton, England, and how seeing bombed out houses in London brought home the reality of war and the fact that he was a participant. The complete interview, as well as a transcript, is available in the repository.
